title: Professional endeavours
text:
Professional statement
Throughout my academic career I have built a broad skillset in research, teaching and learning, project management and mentorship. I am passionate about fostering student learning and I deeply value early career researcher development. I have worked in many diverse team environments and I enjoy developing and driving new collaborative projects, through which I have come to highly appreciate the unique backgrounds, knowledge, and perspectives that each team member brings to the table. I have strong expertise in end-to-end transcriptomics, where I have honed my problem-solving skills, particularly in troubleshooting bioinformatic challenges and adapting to new tools and techniques. I am also proficient in complex molecular techniques, such as RNA extraction, sequencing preparation, and single-cell library preparation, which demonstrates my ability to work with challenging molecular protocols, as well as my meticulous approach to my work.

title: High protein waffles
text:
Ingredients:
Makes 4 waffles

1/2 cup Almond flour
1/4 cup Flour
1/2 tsp Baking powder
2 eggs
2 tbsp Greek yoghurt
2-3 tsp sugar (to taste)

title: High protein waffles
text:
Method:

Combine all ingredients together well
Cook on waffle iron and enjoy!

title: About me
text:
I am currently the Bioinformatics Training Coordinator at Genomics Aotearoa, hosted by the University of Otago.
I live in Dunedin, New Zealand.
This page is not complete, I am still learning how to build a nice website :)

title: Chloe’s mexican-style beans
text:
piccy here


Serves 2-3 people

2 tsp cumin seeds
1/2 tsp coriander seeds
2 tsp smoked paprika
1 small onion, diced
1 tsp garlic, minced
2 cans black beans, rinsed and drained
